snippet: Amid reports of tensions over Syria, Hamas appeared to be trying to keep Prime Minister Ismail Haniya’s visit low-key, while Iran’s news media played it up.
abstract: Ismail Haniya, Hamas prime minister in Gaza, arrives in Iran for a visit that suggests that relations between Hamas and Iran remain good despite reports of tensions over Syria.

byline.original: By FARES AKRAM and ISABEL KERSHNER
byline.contributor: Fares Akram reported from Gaza, and Isabel Kershner from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: Amid reports of tensions over Syria, Hamas appeared to be trying to keep Prime Minister Ismail Haniya’s visit low-key, while Iran’s news media played it up.

headline.seo: Hamas Premier, Ismail Haniya, Visits Iran
headline.main: Hamas Premier Visits Iran in Sign of Strong Relations
headline.print_headline: Hamas Premier Visits Iran In Sign That Ties Are Strong

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
